Toggle Menu

salt.modules.smf

Service support for Solaris 10 and 11, should work with other systems that use SMF also. (e.g. SmartOS)

available

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.available(
								name
								)

Details

Returns True if the specified service is available, otherwise returns False.

We look up the name with the svcs command to get back the FMRI This allows users to use simpler service names

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.available net-snmp

disable

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.disable(
								name,
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Disable the named service to start at boot

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.disable <service name>

disabled

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.disabled(
								name
								)

Details

Check to see if the named service is disabled to start on boot

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.disabled <service name>

enable

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.enable(
								name,
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Enable the named service to start at boot

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.enable <service name>

enabled

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.enabled(
								name,
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Check to see if the named service is enabled to start on boot

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.enabled <service name>

get_all

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.get_all( )

Details

Return all installed services

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.get_all

get_disabled

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.get_disabled( )

Details

Return the disabled services

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.get_disabled

get_enabled

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.get_enabled( )

Details

Return the enabled services

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.get_enabled

get_running

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.get_running( )

Details

Return the running services

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.get_running

get_stopped

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.get_stopped( )

Details

Return the stopped services

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.get_stopped

missing

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.missing(
								name
								)

Details

The inverse of service.available. Returns True if the specified service is not available, otherwise returns False.

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.missing net-snmp

reload_

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.reload_(
								name
								)

Details

Reload the named service

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.reload <service name>

restart

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.restart(
								name
								)

Details

Restart the named service

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.restart <service name>

start

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.start(
								name
								)

Details

Start the specified service

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.start <service name>

status

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.status(
								name,
								sig=None
								)

Details

Return the status for a service, returns a bool whether the service is running.

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.status <service name>

stop

Syntax

salt.modules.smf.stop(
								name
								)

Details

Stop the specified service

CLI Example:

salt '*' service.stop <service name>
